growing.water: Moderate; keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged

planting.spacing: Ensure plants are not too crowded; space clumps about 6-12 inches apart
planting.whenToPlant: Can be planted anytime during the growing season; best in spring or fall for transplants or divisions
planting.propagation: From seed or by dividing mature clumps
planting.depth: Plant seeds or divisions at a shallow depth, about 1/4 inch deep

careAndMaintenance.pruning: Divide clumps every 2-3 years to maintain vigor; regularly trim to encourage new growth
careAndMaintenance.general: Remove flower heads if you donâ€™t want self-seeding; mulch to retain moisture

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: Harvest several times a year, once plants are established and about 6 inches tall
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Cut leaves down to the base using scissors or a sharp knife, leaving about 1 inch above soil level to encourage regrowth
harvestingAndUsage.preservation: Can be dried or frozen for later use

ecologicalInfo.wildlifeResistance: Deters many pests and is a beneficial companion plant
